subject: Re: [junit] Why should I continue to use junit.swingui.TestRunner with JUnit 4.1 ?
msgSnippet: Hi, I agree with Kent: There is sufficient support in all IDE s that there will be no really need to maintain an JUnit owned UI based runner. But, I heard
messageBody:
Hi,

I agree with Kent: There is sufficient support in all IDE's that there will
be no really need to maintain an JUnit owned UI based runner.

But, I heard sometimes complaints of people familiar using the "old"
runners, or using individual extensions of the awt or swing based runner,
that the code is missing now.

Therefore, I put together the latest JUnit 3.8.2 version, which is able to
work with JUnit 4.x (using the builtin adapters). It is an optional part of
some small JUnit extension. For more information, see or download at
http://www.junitext.org The jar file contained in junitext-0.2.0.zip is
named "junit-ui-runners-3.8.2.jar".

HTH, Jochen

On 11/18/06, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> Dear Al,
>
> We wrote the graphical runners because at the time there was no way to run
> tests besides the ugly/retro text runner. Once IDEs supported JUnit, it no
> longer made sense from a practical perspective to continue supporting the
> standalone runners. Aesthetically I prefer to have a design that depends
> only on basic Java rather than a large, relatively high-level GUI library.
>
> Regards,
>
> Kent Beck
> Three Rivers Institute
>
> _____

> class isn't available anymore in the version 4.1. As I said in the
> beginning of my post, I want to change to 4.1 definitely and I like to
> know whether I have to forget the Swing GUI runner or not. I don't
> want to include the java.jar of the previous version just to be able
> to run that runner. The problem is I liked to run my tests outside
> Eclipse using that special Swing test runner, but if someone tell me
> the reasons why it has been removed, I'll try to forget to use it anymore.
>
> In that case, I'll use Eclipse as a graphical user interface
> environment to run my JUnit tests and I will use the console mode
> throught ant to quickly verify my code.
